title: World-Wide
text:
The U.S. and South Korea agreed on a new accord that would resolve a yearslong dispute on how to share the cost of American troops based on the Korean peninsula.

---

Biden signed an executive order directing U.S. agencies to take steps to promote access to voting, as a voting-rights bill faces GOP opposition in the Senate.

---

Russian intelligence agencies have mounted a campaign to undermine confidence in Western vaccines, U.S. officials said.

U.S. government scientists are resisting calls for one-dose regimens for two Covid-19 vaccines designed to be given with two shots.

---

A cyberattack on Microsoft 's Exchange email software is believed to have infected tens of thousands of U.S. businesses, government offices and schools.

---

China laid out plans to speed up development of advanced technologies over five years, raising the stakes in the tech race with the U.S.
